required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Peripheral Interfaces in Amputees for Sensorimotor Integration
clinical_study.official_title: Peripheral Interfaces in Amputees for Sensorimotor Integration

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to gather information on the safety and effectiveness of an implanted wireless sensory enabled highly intuitive controlled prosthetic device.

detailed_description.textblock: The study involves a surgical implant of cuff electrodes on the residual nerves in the amputated limb, and muscle recording electrodes in muscles. These will be connected to an implanted stimulator. The stimulator will connect wirelessly to an advanced prosthesis. This may allow the user to move the prosthetic hand intuitively and feel what the prosthesis is touching.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study is designed as a randomized clinical trial in a small population of subjects to answer the primary question of whether use of a sensory-enabled, high degree-of-freedom (SE-ihDOF) prosthesis with the iSens system improves the subject's quality of life compared to use of their prescribed state-of-art (SOA) prosthesis
study_design_info.masking_description: The assessments will be analyzed by a blinded assessor.

primary_outcome.measure: Orthotics and Prosthetics Users Survey (OPUS) Quality of Life Index
primary_outcome.description: Consists of 23 items related to perceived limitations due to the prosthesis, restrictions in abilities, the attitudes or reactions of others, activity interference due to emotional problems, and various aspects of the participant's emotional state. Score is the sum of the scores for the 23 items (0 - 92). A higher score indicates a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.description: Measuring the change in numbers of blocks moved during a timed test.

arm_group.description: 3 months trial with the iSens system
3 months trial with their own prosthesis.

intervention.description: The study involves a surgical implant of cuff electrodes on the nerves in the amputated limb, and muscle recording electrodes the remaining muscles. These will be connected to an implanted stimulator. The stimulator will connect wirelessly to an advanced prosthesis. This may allow a user to move the prosthetic hand intuitively and feel what your prosthesis is touching.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 21 or greater
- Acquired upper limb amputation
- Unilateral or bilateral amputation, Above or below elbow
- At least 6 months since time of amputation
- Current user of a myoelectric prosthesis or prescribed to use one
- Viable target nerves in the upper extremity *
- Recommendation from a psychologist following a psychological assessment that the subject is mentally competent and capable of completing the study related activities
Exclusion Criteria:
- A contraindication preventing surgery
- Uncontrolled diabetes
- Chronic skin ulcerations
- History of poor wound healing without specific cause
- History of uncontrolled infection without specific cause
- Active infection
- Pregnancy or women of childbearing potential unwilling to prevent pregnancy during participation in the study
- Inability to speak English
- Expectation that MRI will be required at any point for duration of study or while device is implanted.
- Arthritis in the area of implant
- Individuals with active implantable medical devices or individuals that use external active medical devices that are medically necessary and/or life-supporting or life-sustaining (e.g. insulin pumps, ventilators)
- Presence of auto immune diseases, or conditions requiring immunosuppression.

overall_official.affiliation: Louis Stokes VA Medical Center, Cleveland, OH

facility.name: Louis Stokes VA Medical Center, Cleveland, OH

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified data will be uploaded to a data repository.
